1.title: Action
1.content: Action . You can see action used in various modules and add new action details manually or import complete file contain list of action name and their details. Also, edit existing action's detail in the system for futher use. . "Action" tab is accessiable from the sidebar as a "Masters" submenu item. Click on it to get in-depth data view of all the venders. . . You can search for the action(s) by entering its details in the search field. . . Or, you can click on dropdown icon for advance serach in which you are having more option to filter out list. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form values. . . Click on "Search" button to search for the result. . . You can find action list in the table. . . You can edit the particular action detail from the system by double clicking on the respective row of the table. . . System then populates a screen where you can see the complete detail of that particular action including action name, action short name, action description, action URL. You can edit any field by clicking on them. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form. . . Click on "Save" button to save the filled details in the system. . . You can also add new role by clicking on "New" button present on the top right corner on the main screen. . . Fill the following information to add new action in the system. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form. . . Click on "Save" button to save the filled details in the system. . Click on “Import” button so that you can import the complete file having required data in one go. </p> . Follow the steps present in "Import" tab present the sidenav of this documentation. . Below are the input fields used in this screen: . Name of the field Entry Mode Mandatory Comments . Action Name | Free text with dropdown | Yes | You have to enter starting three alphabets of the module name and it will show you the result based on that. Once you select module name it will auto fill some fields like Action Short Name, Action Descriptio, Action Url. You have to fill that too. | . Action Short Name | Free text | Yes | System generated once you select module name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Code should be in captial letters always. | . Action Description | Free text | Yes | System generated once you select module name. Also, you can fill it | . Action Url | Free text | Yes | System generated once you select module name. Also, you can fill it | . Is Active | Switch (Toggle) Button | Yes | Yes/No | .

2.title: Admissions
2.content: Admissions . In 'Admissions' section you can see all the admissions done in the lounge on which date, in which outlet, from which airlines, etc. . "Admissions" tab is accessiable from the sidebar. Click on it to get in-depth data view of the admissions. . . You can search for the admission(s) by entering its details in the search field. . . Or, you can click on dropdown icon for advance serach in which you are having more option to filter out list. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form values. . . Click on "Search" button to search for the result. . . You can find admissions list in the table. . . You can view admission's details by double click on that row of the table for whose details you want to see. . System then populates a screen where you can see the complete detail of that particular order including admission number, member ID, flight no, airlines, outlet name, etc. .

3.title: Admission Instruction
3.content: Admission Instruction . You can add new tokens manually or import complete file containing list of Admission Instructions and their details. Also, edit existing Admission Instruction's details in the system for futher use. . "Admission Instruction" tab is accessiable from the sidebar as a "Masters" submenu item. Click on it to get in-depth data view of all the Admission Instructions. . . You can search for the Admission Instruction(s) by entering its details in the search field. . . Or, you can click on dropdown icon for advance serach in which you are having more option to filter out list. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form values. . . Click on "Search" button to search for the result. . . You can find Admission Instructions list in the table. . . You can download the file of Admission Instructions by clicking on download icon in the "Action" column of table. . . You can view Admission Instruction's details by double click on that row of the table for whose details you want to see. . . System then populates a screen where you can see the complete detail of that particular Admission Instruction including Admission Instruction name, type, category, partner name, etc. . . Also, you can see seven horizontal tabs in the details page below the form fields - Token Identification, Applicable At, Entitlements, Documents Required, Token Samples, Generate/Import Tokens, Localisation. . . By default "Token Identification" data is visible, where you can see the mask patterns, issuing country and other details related to tokens. . . You can find the table for exisitng tokens. . . You can also delete the pattern by clicking on trash icon in the particular row of table. . . Double click on the any row to view its detailed information. . . The system will populate the new screen for you, where you can view/edit the existing information. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the edited fields. . . Click on "Add Pattern" to save the edited fields changes. . . You can also add new patterns by clicking on "Add New Pattern" button present on the top of the table. . . In this screen, you can fill the following details to add new pattern. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset form values. . . Click on "Add New Pattern" to save the information. . . Click on "Applicable At" tab to view, edit or new add applicable at in the system. . . You can find the table of existing bin ranges and outlet details. . . Double click on the any row to view its detailed information. . . The system will populate the new screen for you, where you can view/edit the existing information. . . You can filter out the table data by following inputs. . . Click on "Search" button after adding inputs on the basis of which you want to filter out the data. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form fields. . . You can also select multiple outlets by checking the checkbox(es) at a time. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the edited fields. . . Click on "Add Applicable At" to save the edited fields changes. . . You can also add new bin range by clicking on "Add New Applicable At" button present on the top of the table. . . In this screen, you can fill the bin range at which the token is applicable at. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the fields. . . Click on "Add Applicable At" to save the data. . . Click on "Entitlements" tab to view, edit or new entitlements. . . You can find the table of entitlements. . . Double click on the any row to view its detailed information. . . The system will populate the new screen for you, where you can view/edit the existing information. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the edited fields. . . Click on "Add Entitlements" to save the edited fields changes. . . You can also add new entitlements by clicking on "Add New Entitlements" button present on the top of the table. . . In this screen, you can fill the bin range to add new entitlement in the system. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the fields. . . Click on "Add Entitlements" to save the data. . . Click on "Documents Required" tab to view the existing documents in the system. . . You can find the table for existing documents. . . Click on checkbox(es) in row of the table which document you want to save for that token. . . Click on "Update Documents" button to save/update the documents for the token. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the selected documents. . . Click on "Token Samples" tab to view, delete or add new sample images for the token. . . You can find the sample images for tokens. . . Hover on any image and you will find the delete(trash) icon, click on it if you want to delete that image. . . You can also add new sample image(s) by clicking on "Add Token Sample" button present on the top of the table. . . In this screen, you can upload single/multiple image for tokens in the system. . . Click on "Generate/Import Token" tab to view, edit or add new token. . . You can find the table of generated tokens. . . You can delete token by clicking on the delete icon present in the "Action" column of table. . <!– <p>Double click on the any row to view its detailed information.</p> . The system will populate the new screen for you, where you can view/edit the existing information. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the edited fields. . . Click on "Add Token ID" to save the edited fields changes. . –> . You can also add new token ID by clicking on "Add New Token ID" button present on the top of the table. . . In this screen, you can fill the required details to add new token ID in the system. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the fields. . . Click on "Add Token ID" to save the data. . . Click on "Localisation" tab to view the data in different languages. . . You can find the table for existing attributes. . . Click on "Save" to save the data. . . You can also add new token by clicking on "New" button present on the top right corner on the main screen. . . Fill the following information to add new token in the system. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form. . . Click on "Save Draft" button to save the filled details in the system. . . Click on "Clone Token" button to clone(copy) of the token in draft mode, which you can edit. . . Once you click on it, it will open the popup for you. Click on "Yes" button to make the copy of the token. . . Else, click on "No" button. . . Click on "Import" button so that you can import the complete file having required data in one go. . . Follow the steps present in "Import" tab present the sidenav of this documentation. .

4.title: Port/Station
4.content: Port/Station . You can add multiple port/station directly by importing complete file containing list of port/station and their details. . "Port/Station" tab is accessiable from the sidebar as a "Masters" submenu item. Click on it to get in-depth data view of all the ports/stations. . . You can search for the port(s)/station(s) by entering its details in the search field. . . Or, you can click on dropdown icon for advance serach in which you are having more option to filter out list. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form values. . . Click on "Search" button to search for the result. . . You can find port/station list in the table. . . Click on "Import" button so that you can import the complete file having required data in one go. . . Follow the steps present in "Import" tab present the sidenav of this documentation. .

5.title: Blacklisted Token
5.content: Blacklisted Token . This API allows publisher/partner to get blacklisted token by using the parameters mentioned below: . { "token": 234568777799, "tokenType": "Vouchers", "startDate":"08-03-2022", "endDate":"08-04-2022" } . Request URL . POST: https://dev-us-lms-backendapi.plaza-network.com/api/fe/v1/plaza/lms/blacklistedToken . Parameters Description . Parameter Type Mandatory* Description . token | Number | Mandatory* | User can get details only about specifin token. This is created at the time of admission. | . Token type | Options | Mandatory* | Tells you the type of admission it is, like QR code, credit card, boarding pass. | . startDate | Date | Mandatory* | Help the user to know about the status of the order starting from the mentioned date. | . endDate | Date | Mandatory* | Help the user to know about the status of the order till the mentioned date. | . Responses . Success: . { "status": 0, "tag": " /v1/api/plaza/lms/blacklistedToken", "input": { "token": 234568777799, "tokenType": "Vouchers", "startDate": "08-03-2022", "endDate": "08-04-2022" }, "result": "", "description": "token could not found" } .

Parameter Type Mandatory* Description . isManual | Boolean | Optional* | | . createTime | Date | Mandatory* | This is date and time of creation of boarding pass. | . flightFrom | string | Optional* | This is country code from where flight departure. | . flightTo | string | Optional* | This is city code where flight landed. | . fromCity | string | Optional* | This is city code where flight landed. | . toCity | string | Optional* | This is city code where flight landed. | . airlineCode | string | Optional* | This is airline code under which that flight belongs. | . flightNumber | Number | Optional* | This is a unique number provided to every flight. | . classCode | string | Optional* | This is the code of class in which user travel in flight | . dateOfFlight | Date | Optional* | This is the date of journey. | . seatNumber | string | Optional* | This is seat number aloted to user. | . airlineNumericCode | Number | Optional* | This is airline code in numbers. | . id | string | Mandatory* | This is unique id of users boarding pass. | . 31.title: Getting Started
31.content: PPG LMS . PPG LMS is the system where you can handle all the operations related to different or multiple lounges in different or same Airport. . Here you can view, manage or add new users, members, Admission Instructions, partners, outlets, products, airports, devices. It will help you to easily handle each and every operation realted to lounge in efficient manner. . User have to follow the steps while using the system: . User have to login to the system. You can login using your google or facebook account also. . If you are using the system for the first time then click on "Sign Up" link. . Then, fill the following details to create your account. . If user, forgot the password then click on "Forgot Password" link. . The system opens the modal where you can enter your email address and click on "Continue" button. The link send to your email id by using it you can reset your password. . Click on "Return to Login" link to get back to login page. . Once, user login in to the system. He/She will handle/see the screens which they want to work on. .

32.title: Whitelisted Token
32.content: Whitelisted Token . This API allows publisher/partner to get whitelisted token by using the parameters mentioned below: . { "token": 234568777788, "tokenType": "Vouchers", "quota": 10, "startDate":"08-03-2022", "endDate":"08-04-2022" } . Request URL . POST: https://dev-us-lms-backendapi.plaza-network.com/api/fe/v1/plaza/lms/whitelistedToken . Parameters Description . Parameter Type Mandatory* Description . token | Number | Mandatory* | User can get details only about specifin token. This is created at the time of admission. | . Token type | Options | Mandatory* | Tells you the type of admission it is, like QR code, credit card, boarding pass. | . Quota | Number | Mandatory* | Number of quota this token has. | . startDate | Date | Mandatory* | Help the user to know about the status of the order starting from the mentioned date. | . endDate | Date | Mandatory* | Help the user to know about the status of the order till the mentioned date. | . Responses . 36.title: Dashboard
36.content: Dashboard . In 'Dashboard' section you can see everything related to the system at one page like orders, members, admissions, today's count, top selling products, partner names, etc. . "Dashbaord" tab is open by default once you logged in the system. Else, it is accessiable from the sidebar. Click on it to get in-depth data view of the entire system. . . In top left section, you can see the count of the users, partners, orders and product. You can filter out the data by values given in dropdown like last week, last moth, last year, all time. . . In the right of it, you can see the members currently present in the lounge and the count of current Admission Instructions. . . In "Today's Count in Lounge" you can see the line graph based on timings. You can see the number of persons available in any particular hour of the day. You can filter out the data by values given in dropdown like last week, last moth, last year, all time. . . In "Top Selling Products" you can see the doughnut graph which represents the top 5 selling products in the lounge with its count. You can filter out the data by values given in dropdown like last week, last moth, last year, all time. . . In "Total Sales" you can see the bar graph where you can see the sales per month. You can filter out the data by values given in dropdown like last week, last moth, last year, all time. . . In "Top 3 Facilities" you can see the top facilities provided in the lounge like Spa Service, Meeting Area and Kids Area were the top facilities or can say maximum person take these facilities. . . In "Visit by Admission Instruction Name" you can see the piechart where you can figure out by which mode you got the admissions including their count. You can filter out the data by values given in dropdown like last week, last moth, last year, all time. . . In "Visit by Partner Name" you can see the piechart which helps you in telling that how many persons visiting your lounge with the particular partner. You can filter out the data by values given in dropdown like last week, last moth, last year, all time. . .

41.title: Guest Admission
41.content: Guest Admission . On the visit to the lounge, guest will have to present his Admission Instruction to GSO. Admission Instruction is entered in the system to check certain parameters. First system identifies the entitlements to the token and its partnen then subsequent checks follow. . Blacklisting check: System checks if the Given card number restricted for admisson. Please contact issuing bank. or not. If found blacklisted, guest is not allowed to the lounge. If not blacklisted, system moves to the next check. . Partner Contract check: A valid Partner Contract is also checked in the system. If a valid Partner Contract is not found against the system, guest is not allowed. If the Partner Contract is valid, it moves to the next steps. . Consumption quota check: System checks for comsumption quota in the database and see if guest is still left with entitlements to the token. If nothing is available in quota, guest is not allowed to the lounge. If not, system moves to the next check. . Quota check from Partner APIs: Partner APIs are called to check for quota and entitlements. If Partner rejects the request, guest is not allowed, else system moved ahead. . Guest admission: After all these successful checks, guest is allowed to the lounge based on entitlements and token is redeemed. .

44.title: New LMS User Setup
44.content: New LMS User Setup . User Sign-up: Self sign-up by using his details. After successful sign-up user, Cognito creates user in "contractor user pool". A LMS webhook is called from Cognito to create new user in the system. After that, admin will add outlets to that user and assign some roles. Now, user can log in via Cognito. . User Sign-in: You will go the sign-in page. After successful sign-in using cognito, LMS login API will be called using JWT. This checks if user exists in the system or not. User authorization is checked for an outlet based on roles assigned. If not authorized, user will be redirected to login page. On successful authorization, user will be able to login to the system. Now based on roles assigned, user can perform certain operations in LMS. . Sign-in-Process: . To "Sign-In" or "Sign-Up",Go to "https://market-api.com" . 1. If you do not have an account , click on Sign-up link. . 2. Fill the required information and click on Sign-up button. . Note: After Sign-up ,user can only "Sign-In" once's ,the user is confirm from AWS console by the admin and role(s) ,outlet(s) are assigned(in LMS). . 3. Admin will click-on "Sign In to the console button" ,in AWS console and login to the system. . 4. In Sign-In option click on root-user and enter the credentials. . 5. Click on "Cognito". . 6. Click on "Manage User Pools". . 7. Click on "plazauserconfirme". . 8. Click on "Users and groups" . . 9. Search for newly created user enter the user name in the input field and press enter to search newly created user. . 10. Click on "Confirm-button" to confirm the user . . Note: Now the user is confirmed by the admin. . 11. In the "Master User screen"(LMS) ,newly created user is found on the top,double click on the newly created user to assign role(s) and outlet(s). . 12. Click on "Roles tab", to assign role(s) to the user. . 13. Click on "Outlet access tab", to assign outlet(s) to the user. . 14. Select the "Outlet" assign to the user. . 14. Click on "add user to outlet" button at the bottom. . 15. Now the user is ready to "Sign-in",enter the credentials and click on Sign-in button . . 16. After the successful Sign-In user can access the LMS(homepage) . . User sync-up process: At the interval of every 15 mins, LMS will check cognito for user data updates. Based on the data received, user will be made active or inactive. .

Zone | Selection | Yes | Zone could have following values - Before Security, After Security, In Transit | . Capacity | Number | Yes | Number of people allowed (sitting area) at a time in outlet | . IsActive | Switch (Toggle) button | Yes | Yes/No | . Is Secured | Switch (Toggle) button | Yes | Yes/No | . Secured By | Selection | Yes | Secured By could have following values - Lock and Key, Admission Instruction, E-Gate Pass, None | . Base Currency | Selection | Yes | ISO Code of currency. Currently currency could have following values - USD, YEN | . Date of Opening | Date | Yes | Date of opening of outlet | . Phone No | Number | Yes | Phone number of the outlet | . Fax | Free text | No | Fax number of the outlet | . Comment | Free text | Yes | Enter comment if you want to add for the outlet | . 47.title: Overview
47.content: Overview . Welcome to PPG LMS. This is the quick overview of the system that gives the arial view of the features. . Just after you login there is the dashboard screen that gives the overall status of the system. . On Dashboard you can see some key stats such as number of users, partners, orders, and products etc. You can also see the current count of members and Admission Instructions in the lounge. . Dashboard have some stats with visual representation of data in forms of ghraphs and charts. Some of these are: Today's count in lounge, Top selling products, Total sales, Visit by Admission Instruction name, and Visit by partner name etc. At some places the data is grouped while visualised for better understanding of the ratio. You can filter these stats with dropdowns having options for last week, month, year and all time. . On the left side navbar, there are many items that can help you to navigate to specific sreens to see and manage things in detail. . In admission, see the list of admissions for the lounge service. Each entry has some key information attached to it. . Orders section contains the list of orders received for a lounge. More details can be viewed for a particular order. . Partner responses contains responses list from partners for a given outlet. Every response has some metadata associated with it. . Adding each record to the system can be very time consuing at time. To save time, go to File Import/Export section and import data from sheets with just few click. You can export the data out if needed. . Masters section has a sub-menu which contains many options that you can manage. These are Partners, Outlets, Products, Admission Instructions, Partner Contracts, Airports, Users, Members, and Devices. You can list, manage or add new entries for these masters. This is just an overview of what you can manage with PPG LMS. For more details about each section, please refer to the related documentation page. .

ERP Accounting Code | Free text | No | You can enter ERP accounting code for the partner. | . Partner Entity Name | Free text | Yes | Enter partner's entity name. | . Partner Entity Tax Identification Number | Free text | Yes | Enter the tax number for partner entity's verification. | . Partner Entity Category | Selection | Yes | Category could have following values - Domestic & International. | . Address Line 1 | Free text | Yes | Enter the address of the partner's entity. | . Address Line 2 | Free text | No | Enter the address of the partner's entity. | . Postal Code | Number | Yes | Enter the area code of the partner's entity address. | . State | Free text | Yes | Enter the state to which the partner's entity address belongs to. | . City | Free text | Yes | Enter the city to which the partner's entity address belongs to. | . Country | Selection | Yes | Zone could have following values - United States of America, Hong Kong. | . Partner Short Code | Free text | Yes | User should enter a short code that can be used to identify the partner. It should be in captial letter always. | . Click on "Import" button so that you can import the complete file having required data in one go. . . Follow the steps present in "Import" tab present the sidenav of this documentation. . Below are the input fields used in this screen: . Name of the field Entry Mode Mandatory Comments . Template Name | Free text | Yes | You can fill it yourself. | . Template Category | Selection | Yes | You can select it yourself. | . Applicable to Vendor | Selection | Yes | System generated once you select template name. It shows the list, you can select in this list Also, you can fill it out yourself. | . Country | Selection | Yes | System generated list , you can select it yourself. | . Template Width (in mm) | Selection | Yes | You can increase and decrease the width of recipt slip . | . Font Size | number | Yes | You can select the font size according to your requirement. | . Font Type | Text | Yes | System generated list ,you can select the font inn this list. | . Template Short Code | Free text | Yes | You can enter Template Short Code. | . Status | Selection | Yes | System generated once you select partner name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Status could have following values - Active, Inactive | .

You can search for the role(s) by entering its details in the search field. . . Or, you can click on dropdown icon for advance serach in which you are having more option to filter out list. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form values. . . Click on "Search" button to search for the result. . . You can find roles list in the table. . . You can edit the particular role from the system by double clicking on the respective row of the table. . . System then populates a screen where you can see the complete detail of that particular role including role name, role short name, role description. . . Also, you can see two horizontal tabs in the details page below the form fields - Allow Module Action and Deny Module Action. . . By default "Allow Module Action" data is visible, where you can see the table of allow module action. . . You can also allow new module action by clicking on "Add New Action For Allow" button present on the top of the table. . . In this screen, you can fill the following details to allow new module action in the system. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the fields. . . Click on "Add Action button" to save the data. . . Click on "Deny Module Action" tab to view deny module action information. . . You can also add new deny action by clicking on "Add New Action For Deny" button present on the top right corner on the main screen. . . Fill the following information to deny new module action in the system. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form. . . Click on "Add Action" button to save the filled details in the system. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the fields. . . Click on "Save" to save the data. . . Click on "Import" button so that you can import the complete file having required data in one go. . . Follow the steps present in "Import" tab present the sidenav of this documentation. . Below are the input fields used in this screen: . Name of the field Entry Mode Mandatory Comments . Role Name | Free text with dropdown | Yes | You have to enter starting three alphabets of the module name and it will show you the result based on that. Once you select module name it will auto fill some fields like Action Short Name, Action Descriptio, Action Url. You have to fill that too. | . Role Short Name | Free text | Yes | System generated once you select module name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Code should be in captial letters always. | . Role Description | Free text | Yes | System generated once you select module name. Also, you can fill it | . Is Active | Switch (Toggle) Button | Yes | Yes/No | . Module Name | Free text with dropdown | Yes | You have to enter starting three alphabets of the module name and it will show you the result based on that. | .

55.title: Setup New Admission Instruction
55.content: Setup New Admission Instruction . To setup new Admission Instruction, you should have Partner, Outlet and Product in the sytem. To create any of these, please refer to the steps given below. . Create Partner: First navigate to Partner screen under Master menu. Click on New button to add new Partner. To know more about Partner screen in detail, please click here. . Create Outlet: First navigate to Outlet screen under Master menu. Click on New button to add new Outlet. To know more about Outlet screen in detail, please click here. . Create Product: First navigate to Product screen under Master menu. Click on New button to add new Product. To know more about Product screen in detail, please click here. . Create Admission Instruction: Now go to the system and navigate to Admission Instruction screen under Master menu. Click on New button to add new Token. Once added you can see your token in the list. To know more about Admisson Token screen, please click here. . Create Partner Contract: To create Partner Contract, please navigate to Partner Contract section under Master menu. Create a new Partner Contract by click on New button and after successful operation, Token will be ready for admission. For more details about Partner Contract, please click here. .

57.title: Token
57.content: Token . You can check the token list with its each and every detail which have been placed till date. . "Token" tab is accessiable from the sidebar. Click on it to get in-depth data view of all the orders. . . You can search for the token(s) by entering its details in the search field. . . Or, you can click on dropdown icon for advance serach in which you are having more option to filter out list. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form values. . . Click on "Search" button to search for the result. . . You can find token in the table. . . On first Screen "WhiteList" tokens is visible . . . On the right side of the token, click on the blacklist button you can see this token is on the blacklist . . System then populates a screen where you can see the complete detail of that particular token including reason and Comments. . . Click on "Close" button to close the populate window . . . Click on "Save" button to save the details. . . YOU can back to the "WhiteList" token screen, by clicking on the WhiteList button on right-hand side. . . System then populates a screen where you can see the complete detail of that particular token including quota,start date and end date. . . Click on "Close" button to close the populate window . . . Click on "Save" button to save the details. . .

58.title: Users
58.content: Users . You can add new users manually or import complete file containing list of users and their details. Also, edit existing user's details in the system for futher use. . "Users" tab is accessiable from the sidebar as a "Masters" submenu item. Click on it to get in-depth data view of all the users. . . You can search for the user(s) by entering its details in the search field. . . Or, you can click on dropdown icon for advance serach in which you are having more option to filter out list. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form values. . . Click on "Search" button to search for the result. . . You can find users list in the table. . . You can edit/delete the particular user from the system by clicking on the respective icons present in the "Action" column of the table. . . If you have clicked on delete(trash) icon then it will open the popup for you, where you have to click on "Yes' button if you are sure about deleting. Else, click on the "No" button. . . If you have clicked on edit icon then you can see the details of that particular user. Or, you can double click on the row of the table to view/edit particular user information. . . System then populates a screen where you can see the complete detail of that particular users including users name, mobile number, email, status, etc. . . Also, you can see two horizontal tabs in the details page below the form fields - Roles, Outlet Access. . . By default "Roles" data is visible, where you can see all the roles available for accessing the system. . . You can see some checkbox(es) are selected in the first column are those roles which have been assigned to the user. . . You can also check/uncheck the checkbox(es) according to your requirement. Only checked checkboxes roles are assigned to user. . . Click on "Save" button to save the changes. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the changes done. . . Click on "Outlet Access" tab to view, edit or new add outlet for user. . . You can find the table of existing outlets. . . Double click on the any row to view its detailed information. . . The system will populate the new screen for you, where you can view/edit the existing information. . . You can filter out the list by giving input in the form. . . Then, click on "Search" button to filter out the result in table. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the input fields and table. . . You can see some checkbox(es) are selected in the first column are those outlets which user can access or part of it. . . You can also check/uncheck the checkbox(es) according to your requirement. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset edited information. . . Click on "Add User To Outlet" to save the edited information. . . You can also add new outlet for user by clicking on "Add User To Outlet" button present on the top of the table. . . In this screen, you can fill the form using which you can filter out the table on the basis of input you have entered. . . Click on "Search" button to filter out the table. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the input fields. . . You will see the table in which you can select the checkbox(es) for selecting or adding the outlet for user. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the table. . . Click on "Add User To Outlet" to save the data. . . You can also add new user in the system by clicking on "New" button on the top right of the main screen. . . Fill the following information and then assign role by selecing checkbox(es) in the table. . . Assign roles to user by checking checkbox in the table. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form. . . Click on "Save" button to save the filled details in the system. . . Click on "Import" button so that you can import the complete file having required data in one go. . . Follow the steps present in "Import" tab present the sidenav of this documentation. . Below are the input fields used in this screen: . Name of the field Entry Mode Mandatory Comments . User Name | Free text with dropdown | Yes | You have to enter starting three alphabets of the user name and it will show you the result based on that. Once you have selected any user from the dropdown or write its name, you will see some of the fields get auto filled. | . User Type | Selection | Yes | System generated once you select user name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Type could have following values - Plaza, Partner. | . Default Outlet Access | Selection | Yes | System generated once you select user name. Also, you can fill it yourself. You have to enter starting three alphabets of the oulet and it will show you the result based on that. | . Mobile Number | Number | Yes | System generated once you select user name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Enter the phone of the user. | . Email | Email | Yes | System generated once you select user name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Enter the email id of the user. | . Business Line | Number | Yes | System generated once you select user name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Type could have following values - Lounge. | . Remore User ID | Free text | Yes | System generated once you select user name. Also, you can fill it yourself. You can give user id as you want. | . Is Active | Switch(toggle) button | Yes | Yes/No | . Roles | Checkbox(es) | Yes | Check the checkbox(es) which role(s) you want to give to the user and it is present in the first column of each row in the table. | . Outlet Access | Checkbox(es) | Yes | Check the checkbox(es) which outlet(s) access you want to give to the user and it is present in the first column of each row in the table. | .

Also, you can see two horizontal tabs in the details page below the form fields - Vendor Entities and Vendor Contacts. . . By default "Vendor Entities" data is visible, where you can see the table of vendor entities. . . You can edit/delete the particular entity from the system by clicking on the respective icons present in the "Action" column of the table. . . If you have clicked on delete(trash) icon then it will open the popup for you, where you have to click on "Yes' button if you are sure about deleting. Else, click on the "No" button. . . If you have clicked on edit icon then you can see the details of that particular entity. Or, you can double click on the row of the table to view/edit particular entities information. . . The system will populate the new screen for you, where you can view/edit the existing information. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the edited fields. . . Click on "Add Entity" to save the edited fields changes. . . You can also add new entity by clicking on "Add Entity" button present on the top of the table. . . In this screen, you can fill the following details to add new entity in the system. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the fields. . . Click on "Save button" to save the data. . . Click on "Vendor Contact" tab to view vendor contact information. . . You can edit/delete the particular contact from the system by clicking on the respective icons present in the "Action" column of the table. . . If you have clicked on delete(trash) icon then it will open the popup for you, where you have to click on "Yes' button if you are sure about deleting. Else, click on the "No" button. . . If you have clicked on edit icon then you can see the details of that particular contact. Or, you can double click on the row of the table to view/edit particular contact information. . . The system will populate the new screen for you, where you can view/edit the existing information. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the edited fields. . . Click on "Add Contact" to save the edited fields changes. . . You can also add new vendor by clicking on "New" button present on the top right corner on the main screen. . . Fill the following information to add new vendor in the system. . . Click on "Reset" button to reset the form. . . Click on "Save" button to save the filled details in the system. . . Click on "Vendors Settings" button to view/edit the settings. . . The popup will open for you where you can view/edit the vendors settings. . . Click on "Close" button to close the popup. . . Click on "Save" button to save the save the edited information. . . Click on "Import" button so that you can import the complete file having required data in one go. . . Follow the steps present in "Import" tab present the sidenav of this documentation. . Below are the input fields used in this screen: . Name of the field Entry Mode Mandatory Comments . Vendor Name | Free text with dropdown | Yes | You have to enter starting three alphabets of the vendor name and it will show you the result based on that. Once you select vendor name it will auto fill some fields like Vendor Type, Vendor Category, Tax Identification number, Vendor Short Code, Status and also open Vendor Entity and contact forms. You have to fill that too. | . Vendor Type | Selection | Yes | System generated once you select vendor name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Type could have following values - Financial Institution, Corporated, Lounge Programs. | . Vendor Category | Selection | Yes | System generated once you select vendor name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Category could have following values - Global,Local and Regional. | . Tax Identification No | Free text | Yes | System generated once you select vendor name. Also, you can fill it yourself. | . Status | Selection | Yes | System generated once you select vendor name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Status could have following values - Active, Inactive | . Vendor Short Code | Free text | Yes | System generated once you select vendor name. Also, you can fill it yourself. Code should be in captial letters always. | . Region | Selection | No | Region could have following values - North America, South America, Europe, Middle East, Asia Pacific. | . ERP Accounting Code | Free text | No | You can enter ERP accounting code for the vendor. | . Uploaded Logo | Choose File | Yes | Vendor can upload logo . | . Vendor Entity Name | Free text | Yes | Enter vendor's entity name. | . Vendor Tin | Free text | Yes | Enter the Tin number for vendor entity's verification. | . Vendor Entity Category | Selection | Yes | Category could have following values - Global,Local and Regional. | . Address Line 1 | Free text | Yes | Enter the address of the vendor's entity. | . Address Line 2 | Free text | No | Enter the address of the vendor's entity. | . Postal Code | Number | Yes | Enter the area code of the vendor's entity address. | . State | Free text | Yes | Enter the state to which the vendor's entity address belongs to. | . City | Free text | Yes | Enter the city to which the vendor's entity address belongs to. | . Country | Selection | Yes | Zone could have following values - United States of America, Hong Kong. | . Vendor Short Code | Free text | Yes | User should enter a short code that can be used to identify the vendor. It should be in captial letter always. | . Alliance Program | Selection | No | Alliance Program could have following values - Star Alliance, One World, Skyteam. | . Contact Name | Free Text | Yes | Enter the name of the person to whom we have to contact. | . Contact Designation | Free text | Yes | Enter the designation of the contacted person. | . Contact No | Number | Yes | Enter the phone number of the person whom we have to contact. | . Contact Email | Email | Yes | Enter the email id of the person whom we have to contact. | . Vendor Entity | Free text | Yes | You have to enter starting three alphabets of the vendor entity and it will show you the result based on that. | . Contact Role | Selection | Yes | Contact Role could have following values - Partner, Plaza. | .

60.title: Verify Token
60.content: Verify Token . This API allows publisher/partner to verify token by using the parameters mentioned below: . { "tokenType": 1, "tokenCode": "62d542fbf8c55f12a572a4cf" } . Request URL . POST: https://dev-us-lms-backendapi.plaza-network.com/api/fe/v1/admission/verifytoken . Parameters Description . Parameter Type Mandatory* Description . tokenType | Option | Mandatory* | This is token type that user has to verify. | . tokenCode | String | Mandatory* | This is unique token code for which user has to verify token. | . Responses . Success: .
